Class NumeralConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • NumeralConverter

  • public class NumeralConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main logic class for the numeral conversion application. It's main goal is to use methods to take a numeral of one type and convert it to another. It will also contain methods which will support these main conversion methods, for example validation.
    Author:
    teagen kiel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NumeralConverter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String arabicToRoman(int arabicNumeral)
      Converts an arabic numeral to a roman numeral
      static int romanToArabic(java.lang.String romanNumeral)
      Converts a roman numeral given as a string to its corresponding arabic representation
      static java.lang.String validateRomanNumeral(java.lang.String romanNumeral)
      Since the romanToArabic conversion takes in a combination of roman numerals in any order and computes the arabic number by adding up the numerals, and the arabic to roman conversion takes in an arabic numeral and outputs a correct and valid modern roman numeral, we can combine the two methods to validate a roman numeral.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • arabicToRoman

        public static java.lang.String arabicToRoman(int arabicNumeral)
        Converts an arabic numeral to a roman numeral
        Parameters:
        arabicNumeral - the numeral in arabic form
        Returns:
        a string containing the corresponding roman numeral

      • romanToArabic

        public static int romanToArabic(java.lang.String romanNumeral)
        Converts a roman numeral given as a string to its corresponding arabic representation
        Parameters:
        romanNumeral - a combination in any order of roman numerals as a string
        Returns:

      • validateRomanNumeral

        public static java.lang.String validateRomanNumeral(java.lang.String romanNumeral)
        Since the romanToArabic conversion takes in a combination of roman numerals in any order and computes the arabic number by adding up the numerals, and the arabic to roman conversion takes in an arabic numeral and outputs a correct and valid modern roman numeral, we can combine the two methods to validate a roman numeral.
        Parameters:
        romanNumeral - the roman numeral to be validated
        Returns:
        a validly ordered roman numeral that corresponds with the roman numeral entered
